intro: Conopodium balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic bladder nut, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. Its fruits are small, dry, and contain a single seed, typical of the Apiaceae family. Conopodium balearicum is often found in rocky or calcareous soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal and mountainous environments.
